text: A34927 No Calculator School of Mathematics Programmes in the School of Mathematics First Examination Programmes involving Mathematics First Examination 1SAS 06 34047 Level C LC Sequences and Series January Examinations 2022-23 One Hour and Thirty Minutes Full marks will be obtained with complete answers to BOTH questions. Each question carries equal weight. You are advised to initially spend no more than 45 minutes on each question and then to return to any incomplete questions if you have time at the end. An indication of the number of marks allocated to parts of questions is shown in square brackets. No calculator is permitted in this examination. Page 1 Turn over No Calculator Section A 1. (a) (i) Define what it means for a sequence of real numbers (an) to converge to a real number ℓ. (ii) Using the definition above, prove that the sequence (an) given by an = n2 + 2n + 1 2n2 + 3n − 1 converges to 1 2 . [6] (b) (i) Define what it means for a sequence of real numbers (an) to tend to infinity. (ii) Using the definition above, prove that the sequence (an) given by an = 2n2 + n + 1 3n + 1 tends to infinity. [5] (c) Establish which of the series below converge, justifying your assertions. (i) ∞ ∑ n=1 2n 3n . (ii) ∞ ∑ n=1 (2n)! 3n(n!)2 . (iii) ∞ ∑ n=1 (−1)n+1 √ n . (iv) ∞ ∑ n=1 2n + (−1)n n3 + 2 . (v) ∞ ∑ n=1 ( 1 + 1 n )n . In this question you may appeal to standard results on the convergence of sequences and series, provided you make it clear that you are doing so. [14] A34927 Page 2 Turn over No Calculator Section B In this section you may appeal to standard results on the convergence of sequences and series, provided you make it clear when you do so. 2. (a) A sequence of nonnegative real numbers (an) is defined recursively by the formula an+1 = 2 + an 3 + an , where a1 = 1. (i) Prove that an+2 − an+1 = an+1 − an (3 + an)(3 + an+1) for all n ∈ N. (ii) Use induction to show that (an) is decreasing. (iii) Show that (an) converges, and find its limit, carefully justifying any assertions that you make. (iv) Show further that an+1 − an ≤ 1 4 (1 9 )n−1 for all n ∈ N. [12] (b) (i) Define what it means for a series of real numbers ∞ ∑ n=1 an to converge. (ii) Use the definition to show that the series ∞ ∑ n=1 1 n2 − 1 4 converges, and find its sum. [6] (c) Suppose (an) is a sequence of real numbers such that |an|1/n → 1. Prove that the series ∞ ∑ n=1 anxn converges whenever |x| < 1.
